#Text=Jeffrey Battle
#Text=Jeffrey Leon Battle was a member of a terrorist group dubbed the Portland Seven , some members of which attempted to travel to Afghanistan shortly after 9/11 in order to aid the Taliban .
#Text=He refused to cooperate with the government and was sentenced to eighteen years in prison after pleading guilty to seditious conspiracy and levying war against the United States .
#Text=He had two years added to his sentence for refusing to testify before a grand jury .
#Text=Background
#Text=Jeffrey Battle had a checkered past .

#Text=According to an article in the Star-Ledger , " Battle was a ne'er-do-well , a one-time Mary Kay cosmetics representative who was trying to wriggle out of his commitment to the U.S. Army reserves after washing out in boot camp .

#Text=On September 29 , 2001 , a group of men from what would later be termed the Portland Seven were engaged in shooting practice at a gravel pit in Skamania County , located in southern Washington , including Battle , Ford , al Saoub and Ali Khalid Steitiye , who was not a member of the Portland Seven but convicted in 2002 on firearms , fraud and immigration charges and testified against the others in 2004 as part of a plea agreement in a weapons-possession charge .

#Text=Battle later indicated they had opted not to kill the officer because he seemed  cool . " [ 3 ]

column1: #Text=According to the indictment , on October 17 , 2001 , Battle and al Saoub flew out of Portland International Airport en route to Afghanistan .
#Text=On October 20 , 2001 , Ford and the two Bilals also took the same route out of the United States .
#Text=Between October 2001 and January 2002 , Lewis wired a series of money orders to Battle in China and Bangladesh .
#Text=In January 2002 Battle was administratively discharged from the military .
#Text=Battle returned to the U.S. on or about February 5 , 2002 .
#Text=The six male members of the group travelled to China in early 2002 , with the intent of entering Afghanistan to aid the Taliban .
#Text=Lacking visas and other documentation , they were turned back , and all but al Saoub then returned again to the United States .

#Text=On Thursday , October 3 , 2002 , a federal grand jury in United States District Court for the District of Oregon , at Portland , Oregon , indicted Battle , Ford , the two Bilals , al Saoub and Lewis .
#Text=On October 4 , 2002 the FBI in Portland , Oregon announced the arrest of four of those original six on charges of aiding and , in some cases , trying to join Al-Qaida fighters .
#Text=Battle , Ford and Lewis were all arrested that morning in Portland . [ 4 ]
#Text=Trial
#Text=Battle and October Martinique Lewis , another member of the Portland Seven , were married in 1999 , divorcing after five months ( although they continued to live together ) .
#Text=According to Lewis ' mother , Lewis and Battle had worked in a Portland retirement home . [ 5 ]
#Text=Battle 's attorney said that Battle was motivated by a religious desire to help fellow Muslims .
#Text=However , prosecutors maintain that Battle had earlier considered committing a different terrorist act in the United States .
#Text=" He had said he wanted to kill hundreds of Jews at a Portland-area synagogue or Jewish school . " [ 6 ]
#Text=Fate of other members of the Portland Seven

#Text=Patrice Lumumba Ford , Jeffrey Leon Battle , October Lewis , Muhammad Ibrahim Bilal , his brother Ahmed Ibrahim Bilal , Maher " Mike " Hawash , and Habis Abdulla al Saoub made up the original seven members wanted by the FBI .
#Text=Al Saoub was killed by Pakistani forces in Afghanistan while part of an al Qaeda cell .
#Text=Ford is also serving an eighteen-year sentence .
#Text=Lewis was sentenced to three years in a federal prison camp .
#Text=Muhammad Bilal got eight years while Ahmed Bilal got ten .
#Text=Hawash was sentenced to seven years .
